conclusion: To find the ratio of the magnitudes of acceleration for particles A and B during their acceleration phases, analyze the given v-t graph.
Identify the acceleration phases: A accelerates to 2v0 in time t0; B accelerates to v0 in time 5t0.
Acceleration is the slope of the velocity-time graph.
For particle A, change in velocity is 2v0 and time interval is t0, so acceleration a_A is 2v0/t0.
For particle B, change in velocity is v0 and time interval is 5t0, so acceleration a_B is v0/5t0.
The ratio of the magnitudes of acceleration of A to B is 10.
The ratio of the magnitudes of acceleration for A and B during their acceleration phases is 10:1.
